body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
For unmanaged disk, now it is not working
**What you expected to happen**:
Works well
**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
```
# kubectl get sc
NAME      PROVISIONER                AGE
scazure   kubernetes.io/azure-disk   4h
# kubectl get sc scazure -o yaml
apiVersion: storage.k8s.io/v1
kind: StorageClass
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: 2017-11-15T03:15:24Z
  name: scazure
  resourceVersion: "5718"
  selfLink: /apis/storage.k8s.io/v1/storageclasses/scazure
  uid: 3896d86f-c9b3-11e7-9c74-000d3a139483
parameters:
  location: eastus
  storageAccount: storage
provisioner: kubernetes.io/azure-disk
reclaimPolicy: Delete

# kubectl describe pvc azpvc
Name:          azpvc
Namespace:     default
StorageClass:  scazure
Status:        Pending
Volume:        
Labels:        <none>
Annotations:   volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-class=scazure
               volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-provisioner=kubernetes.io/azure-disk
Capacity:      
Access Modes:  
Events:
  Type     Reason              Age               From                         Message
  ----     ------              ----              ----                         -------
  Warning  ProvisioningFailed  6s (x2 over 17s)  persistentvolume-controller  Failed to provision volume with StorageClass "scazure": Create Storage Account: %!!(MISSING)(EXTRA string=001), error: storage.AccountsClient#Create: Failure responding to request: StatusCode=400 -- Original Error: autorest/azure: Service returned an error. Status=400 Code="InvalidDoubleEncodedRequestUri" Message="The request URI 'https://management.azure.com:443/subscriptions/.../resourceGroups/openshift/providers/Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/%!!(MISSING)(EXTRA%!s(MISSING)tring=001)?api-version=2017-06-01' is not valid, because it contains double encoding sequence '%!'(MISSING)."
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
# kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"9+", GitVersion:"v1.9.0-alpha.2.734+2d64ce5e8e45e2", GitCommit:"2d64ce5e8e45e26b02492d2b6c85e5ebfb1e4761", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-11-14T03:26:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"9+", GitVersion:"v1.9.0-alpha.2.734+2d64ce5e8e45e2", GitCommit:"2d64ce5e8e45e26b02492d2b6c85e5ebfb1e4761", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-11-14T03:26:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): RHEL7
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools: ansible
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

title: Azure disk dose not work as expected
